body_html:
I'm having trouble building Tensorflow with a patched normalization.py file. After uninstalling Tensorflow and installing the new build, I still get the error above. If I copy the file to the current directory and import batch_norm from that module, it runs without the error. Is there another step I'm missing? I'm following the Installing TensorFlow from Sources instructions.

import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.contrib.layers import batch_norm  # error on run
# from normalization import batch_norm  ## no error on run
with tf.Session() as sess, tf.device('/cpu'):
  inputs = tf.convert_to_tensor([1., 2.], dtype=tf.float16)
  norm = batch_norm(inputs)
  sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
  sess.run(norm)

Update: There were 2 entry points!

body:
I'm having trouble building Tensorflow with a patched `normalization.py` file. After uninstalling Tensorflow and installing the new build, I still get the error above. If I copy the file to the current directory and import `batch_norm` from that module, it runs without the error. Is there another step I'm missing? I'm following the [Installing TensorFlow from Sources](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources) instructions.

```py
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.contrib.layers import batch_norm  # error on run
# from normalization import batch_norm  ## no error on run
with tf.Session() as sess, tf.device('/cpu'):
  inputs = tf.convert_to_tensor([1., 2.], dtype=tf.float16)
  norm = batch_norm(inputs)
  sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
  sess.run(norm)
```

Update: There were 2 entry points!
